content:
#12339 is a PR introducing the multiGoal linter: this linter warns you when there is more than one "active" goal in scope (with very few exceptions).

This is useful to structure proofs and make code clearer. There are always a couple of new exceptions that the linter picks up every time I merge master, so the changes are rarely just the addition of the linter. It has already gone through quite a bit of review.
If anyone wants to review it, I'd be very happy!
Ping @Johan Commelin and @Kim Morrison who both were interested in something like this.
In case this is useful, #17966 is a PR that adapts code newly merged into master to comply with the linter. Scrolling through the commits of the linter you can see several other similar PRs.
I just re-reviewed the code and had only documentation comments left to say.

Michael, thanks! I implemented all your suggestions.

There were no changes to the code (except for doc-strings and the message of the linter). I assume that CI will pass, except if the most recent commits to master introduced more violations of the linter.
